education_text.0: Alfred Vaino Aho (born August 9, 1941) is a Canadian      Computer scientist computer scientist best known for his work on      Programming language programming languages,      compilers, and related algorithms, and his textbooks on the art and science of computer programmingAfter graduating from Princeton, Aho joined the Computing Sciences Research Center at Bell Labs where he devised efficient      Regular expression regular expression and pattern matching algorithms that he implemented in the first versions of the      Unix tools code     redirect    egrepAho and Ullman wrote a series of textbooks on compiling techniques that codified the theory relevant to compiler designAho has taught at Columbia University in New York City since 1995
